name: Moses
blurb: Rescued from the Nile by Pharaoh’s daughter, raised in the court, then exiled to Midian after defending a Hebrew. At the burning bush he meets the God of the fathers; reluctant yet called, he confront
searchText: moses person narrative rescued from the nile by pharaoh’s daughter, raised in the court, then exiled to midian after defending a hebrew. at the burning bush he meets the god of the fathers; reluctant yet called, he confronts pharaoh with signs and speeches, leads through the plagues, and brings israel to the sea. moses’ story in these chapters showcases divine compassion, judgment, and the birth of a nation.

name: Aaron
blurb: Moses’ brother and spokesman, later high priest. Performs signs before Pharaoh, stretches the staff over Egypt and the sea, and leads in worship.
searchText: aaron person narrative moses’ brother and spokesman, later high priest. performs signs before pharaoh, stretches the staff over egypt and the sea, and leads in worship.

name: Phinehas
blurb: Son of Eleazar; later zealous for covenant fidelity.
searchText: phinehas person genealogy son of eleazar; later zealous for covenant fidelity.

name: Abihu
blurb: Son of Aaron who participates in the covenant meal; later judged for strange fire.
searchText: abihu person narrative son of aaron who participates in the covenant meal; later judged for strange fire.

name: Eleazar
blurb: Son of Aaron who will succeed him as priest; later father of Phinehas.
searchText: eleazar person narrative son of aaron who will succeed him as priest; later father of phinehas.

name: Miriam
blurb: Prophetess and sister of Moses who watches over him at the river and leads Israel’s women in song after the Sea crossing.
searchText: miriam person narrative prophetess and sister of moses who watches over him at the river and leads israel’s women in song after the sea crossing.

name: Nadab
blurb: Eldest son of Aaron who ascends partway up Sinai; later dies for unauthorized fire—holiness is not casual.
searchText: nadab person narrative eldest son of aaron who ascends partway up sinai; later dies for unauthorized fire—holiness is not casual.

name: Angel of the LORD
blurb: Speaks with divine authority to Hagar and later stays Abraham’s hand on Moriah, revealing God as both holy and merciful.
searchText: angel of the lord figure narrative speaks with divine authority to hagar and later stays abraham’s hand on moriah, revealing god as both holy and merciful. f.angel-of-the-lord--bb1d2281

name: Amalekites
blurb: Nomadic attackers who ambush Israel; God declares war against Amalek from generation to generation.
searchText: amalekites group narrative nomadic attackers who ambush israel; god declares war against amalek from generation to generation.

name: Magicians of Egypt
blurb: Royal sages unable to interpret Pharaoh’s dreams; their inability spotlights Joseph’s God-given insight.
searchText: magicians of egypt group narrative royal sages unable to interpret pharaoh’s dreams; their inability spotlights joseph’s god-given insight.

name: Amram
blurb: Levite of Kohath’s line who marries Jochebed; father of Moses, Aaron, and (by tradition) Miriam. Anchors Moses within Levi’s priestly heritage.

name: Mixed multitude

searchText: pharaoh’s army group narrative chariots and horsemen pursuing israel; swallowed by the sea—an emblem of god’s warrior deliverance.
